# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.reuters.com/world/trump-says-he-discussed-ending-ukraine-war-with-russias-putin-2025-02-12/): 
Content: "[Skip to main content](#main-content)

[Exclusive news, data and analytics for financial market professionalsLearn more aboutRefinitiv](/differentiator/)

*   Summary

*   Trump says he'll meet Putin soon, likely in Saudi Arabia
*   Hegseth says it is unrealistic to expect Ukraine to return to 2014 borders
*   Bessent, in Kyiv, says mineral deal could serve as 'security shield' for Ukraine
*   No publicly acknowledged peace talks have been held since early months of three-year-old war

WASHINGTON/MOSCOW/KYIV, Feb 12 (Reuters) - [Donald Trump](https://www.reuters.com/world/us/donald-trump/)
 said both Russian President [Vladimir Putin](https://www.reuters.com/world/putin/)
 and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy expressed a desire for peace in separate phone calls with him on Wednesday, and Trump ordered top U.S. officials to begin talks on ending the [war in Ukraine](https://www.reuters.com/world/ukraine-russia-war/)
.

The conversations came after Trump's defense secretary earlier said Kyiv would have to give up its long-held goals of joining the NATO military alliance and regaining all of its territory seized by Russia, signaling a dramatic shift in Washington's approach to the conflict.

Sign up [here.](undefined?location=article-paragraph&redirectUrl=%2Fworld%2Ftrump-says-he-discussed-ending-ukraine-war-with-russias-putin-2025-02-12%2F)

After speaking with Putin for more than an hour, Trump said the Russian leader, who launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine in 2022, wants the war to end and they discussed "getting a ceasefire in the not-too-distant future."

"He wants it to end. Trump's predecessor, Joe Biden, oversaw billions of dollars of military and other aid to Kyiv and had no direct contact with Putin after Russia's invasion.

Russia occupies around a fifth of Ukraine and has demanded Kyiv cede more territory and be rendered permanently neutral under any peace deal.

!Cars drive along an embankment in central Moscow <image:4759>

Item 1 of 4 Cars drive along an embankment of the Moskva River near the Kremlin wall in central Moscow, Russia, February 13, 2025. They said they were ready to enhance support for Ukraine and put it in a position of strength.

'ILLUSIONARY GOAL'
------------------

Earlier on Wednesday, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth delivered the new administration's bluntest statement so far on its approach to the war, saying Kyiv could not realistically hope to return to [previous borders](/world/europe/us-defense-chief-hegseth-says-return-ukraines-pre-2014-borders-not-realistic-2025-02-12/)
 or join NATO.

"We want, like you, a sovereign and prosperous Ukraine. troops would not be deployed to Ukraine as part of such guarantees.

Zelenskiy, hoping to keep Trump interested in continuing to support his country, has lately proposed a deal under which the United States would invest in minerals in Ukraine.

Trump's Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, in Kyiv on Wednesday on the first visit by a member of Trump's cabinet, said such a mineral deal could serve as a ["security shield"](/markets/commodities/top-trump-official-kyiv-discuss-deal-minerals-energy-2025-02-12/)
 for Ukraine after the war.

Trump also said Rubio and Vice President JD Vance will hold talks about the war on Friday in Munich, where Ukrainian officials were expected to attend an annual security conference.

The new diplomacy followed a U.S.-Russia prisoner swap that got under way on Tuesday, which the Kremlin said could help build trust between the two countries.

Russia on Tuesday freed American schoolteacher Marc Fogel, who was serving a 14-year sentence in a Russian prison, [in exchange](/world/europe/russia-says-its-getting-back-prisoner-us-return-freeing-teacher-marc-fogel-2025-02-12/)
 for a Russian cybercrime boss imprisoned in the U.S., according to a official.

Trump has long said he would quickly end the war in Ukraine, without spelling out exactly how he would accomplish this.

The Kremlin earlier said Putin and Trump had agreed to meet, and Putin had invited Trump to visit Moscow. Trump said their first meeting would "probably" take place soon in Saudi Arabia.

In a post on his social media platform, he said Secretary of State Marco Rubio, CIA Director John Ratcliffe, national security adviser Michael Waltz and Middle East envoy Steve Witkoff would lead negotiations on ending the war.

===== > RESPONSE:  < =====

Trump ordered top U.S. officials to begin talks on ending the war in Ukraine. The article mentions that Trump said he would meet Putin soon, likely in Saudi Arabia. <image:4759> The article was written by Guy Faulconbridge and published by Thomson Reuters.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "After a call with Russia's President Vladimir Putin on February 12, 2025, US President Donald Trump announced that he had reached an agreement to end the war in Ukraine."

## Actions
```
web_search("Donald Trump Vladimir Putin call February 12 2025 Ukraine war")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/February_2025_Putin%E2%80%93Trump_phone_call): 
Content: The Wikipedia article "February 2025 Putin–Trump phone call" discusses a phone conversation between Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin on February 12, 2025. The article mentions that Trump shared details of the conversation and agreed to begin peace talks. It also notes that the foreign ministers of Ukraine, France, Germany, the United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Poland, and the head of the European External Action Service supported Ukraine and the EU's participation in the negotiation process.


From [Source](https://www.cnn.com/2025/02/12/politics/putin-trump-phone-call): 
Content: The CNN article, published on February 12, 2025, reports that Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin had a phone call on the morning of February 12, 2025. <image:1>, <image:2>. According to Trump, they agreed to have their teams start negotiations immediately to end the war in Ukraine. Trump also mentioned that he would call President Zelenskyy to inform him of the conversation.


From [Source](https://www.reuters.com/world/trump-says-he-discussed-ending-ukraine-war-with-russias-putin-2025-02-12/): 
Content: Reuters reports that on February 12, 2025, Donald Trump spoke with both Vladimir Putin and Volodymyr Zelenskiy, who expressed a desire for peace. Trump ordered top U.S. officials to begin talks on ending the war in Ukraine. The article mentions that Trump said he would meet Putin soon, likely in Saudi Arabia. <image:4759> The article was written by Guy Faulconbridge and published by Thomson Reuters.


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
On February 12, 2025, Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin had a phone call, as reported by CNN ([https://www.cnn.com/2025/02/12/politics/putin-trump-phone-call](https://www.cnn.com/2025/02/12/politics/putin-trump-phone-call)) <image:1>, <image:2>. Trump stated that they agreed to begin negotiations to end the war in Ukraine. Reuters ([https://www.reuters.com/world/trump-says-he-discussed-ending-ukraine-war-with-russias-putin-2025-02-12/](https://www.reuters.com/world/trump-says-he-discussed-ending-ukraine-war-with-russias-putin-2025-02-12/)) also reported that Trump spoke with both Putin and Volodymyr Zelenskiy and ordered U.S. officials to start talks <image:4759>.

The Wikipedia article "February 2025 Putin–Trump phone call" ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/February_2025_Putin%E2%80%93Trump_phone_call](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/February_2025_Putin%E2%80%93Trump_phone_call)) discusses the phone conversation and mentions that Trump shared details and agreed to begin peace talks.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "After a call with Russia's President Vladimir Putin on February 12, 2025, US President Donald Trump announced that he had reached an agreement to end the war in Ukraine."

## Actions
```
web_search("Donald Trump Vladimir Putin call February 12 2025 Ukraine war")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
On February 12, 2025, Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin had a phone call, as reported by CNN ([https://www.cnn.com/2025/02/12/politics/putin-trump-phone-call](https://www.cnn.com/2025/02/12/politics/putin-trump-phone-call)) <image:1>, <image:2>. Trump stated that they agreed to begin negotiations to end the war in Ukraine. Reuters ([https://www.reuters.com/world/trump-says-he-discussed-ending-ukraine-war-with-russias-putin-2025-02-12/](https://www.reuters.com/world/trump-says-he-discussed-ending-ukraine-war-with-russias-putin-2025-02-12/)) also reported that Trump spoke with both Putin and Volodymyr Zelenskiy and ordered U.S. officials to start talks <image:4759>.

The Wikipedia article "February 2025 Putin–Trump phone call" ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/February_2025_Putin%E2%80%93Trump_phone_call](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/February_2025_Putin%E2%80%93Trump_phone_call)) discusses the phone conversation and mentions that Trump shared details and agreed to begin peace talks.


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence confirms that Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin had a phone call on February 12, 2025. According to Reuters ([https://www.reuters.com/world/trump-says-he-discussed-ending-ukraine-war-with-russias-putin-2025-02-12/](https://www.reuters.com/world/trump-says-he-discussed-ending-ukraine-war-with-russias-putin-2025-02-12/)), Trump stated that they discussed ending the war in Ukraine and ordered U.S. officials to start talks. The Wikipedia article also supports this.

However, the evidence does not explicitly state that an agreement to end the war was reached, only that discussions and the beginning of negotiations were agreed upon.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.



## Decision Options
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "After a call with Russia's President Vladimir Putin on February 12, 2025, US President Donald Trump announced that he had reached an agreement to end the war in Ukraine."

## Actions
```
web_search("Donald Trump Vladimir Putin call February 12 2025 Ukraine war")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
On February 12, 2025, Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin had a phone call, as reported by CNN ([https://www.cnn.com/2025/02/12/politics/putin-trump-phone-call](https://www.cnn.com/2025/02/12/politics/putin-trump-phone-call)) <image:1>, <image:2>. Trump stated that they agreed to begin negotiations to end the war in Ukraine. Reuters ([https://www.reuters.com/world/trump-says-he-discussed-ending-ukraine-war-with-russias-putin-2025-02-12/](https://www.reuters.com/world/trump-says-he-discussed-ending-ukraine-war-with-russias-putin-2025-02-12/)) also reported that Trump spoke with both Putin and Volodymyr Zelenskiy and ordered U.S. officials to start talks <image:4759>.

The Wikipedia article "February 2025 Putin–Trump phone call" ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/February_2025_Putin%E2%80%93Trump_phone_call](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/February_2025_Putin%E2%80%93Trump_phone_call)) discusses the phone conversation and mentions that Trump shared details and agreed to begin peace talks.


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin had a phone call on February 12, 2025. According to Reuters ([https://www.reuters.com/world/trump-says-he-discussed-ending-ukraine-war-with-russias-putin-2025-02-12/](https://www.reuters.com/world/trump-says-he-discussed-ending-ukraine-war-with-russias-putin-2025-02-12/)), Trump stated that they discussed ending the war in Ukraine and ordered U.S. officials to start talks. The Wikipedia article also supports this.

However, the evidence does not explicitly state that an agreement to end the war was reached, only that discussions and the beginning of negotiations were agreed upon.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence confirms that Trump and Putin spoke on February 12, 2025, and discussed ending the war in Ukraine, agreeing to begin negotiations. However, the evidence does not support the claim that an agreement to end the war was reached.

`false`

SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "After a call with Russia's President Vladimir Putin on February 12, 2025, US President Donald Trump announced that he had reached an agreement to end the war in Ukraine."

## Actions
```
web_search("Donald Trump Vladimir Putin call February 12 2025 Ukraine war")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
On February 12, 2025, Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin had a phone call, as reported by CNN ([https://www.cnn.com/2025/02/12/politics/putin-trump-phone-call](https://www.cnn.com/2025/02/12/politics/putin-trump-phone-call)) <image:1>, <image:2>. Trump stated that they agreed to begin negotiations to end the war in Ukraine. Reuters ([https://www.reuters.com/world/trump-says-he-discussed-ending-ukraine-war-with-russias-putin-2025-02-12/](https://www.reuters.com/world/trump-says-he-discussed-ending-ukraine-war-with-russias-putin-2025-02-12/)) also reported that Trump spoke with both Putin and Volodymyr Zelenskiy and ordered U.S. officials to start talks <image:4759>.

The Wikipedia article "February 2025 Putin–Trump phone call" ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/February_2025_Putin%E2%80%93Trump_phone_call](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/February_2025_Putin%E2%80%93Trump_phone_call)) discusses the phone conversation and mentions that Trump shared details and agreed to begin peace talks.


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin had a phone call on February 12, 2025. According to Reuters ([https://www.reuters.com/world/trump-says-he-discussed-ending-ukraine-war-with-russias-putin-2025-02-12/](https://www.reuters.com/world/trump-says-he-discussed-ending-ukraine-war-with-russias-putin-2025-02-12/)), Trump stated that they discussed ending the war in Ukraine and ordered U.S. officials to start talks. The Wikipedia article also supports this.

However, the evidence does not explicitly state that an agreement to end the war was reached, only that discussions and the beginning of negotiations were agreed upon.


## Final Judgement
The evidence confirms that Trump and Putin spoke on February 12, 2025, and discussed ending the war in Ukraine, agreeing to begin negotiations. However, the evidence does not support the claim that an agreement to end the war was reached.

`false`


## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
On February 12, 2025, Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin had a phone call, as reported by CNN ([https://www.cnn.com/2025/02/12/politics/putin-trump-phone-call](https://www.cnn.com/2025/02/12/politics/putin-trump-phone-call)) and Reuters ([https://www.reuters.com/world/trump-says-he-discussed-ending-ukraine-war-with-russias-putin-2025-02-12/](https://www.reuters.com/world/trump-says-he-discussed-ending-ukraine-war-with-russias-putin-2025-02-12/)). While they discussed ending the war in Ukraine and agreed to begin negotiations, there is no evidence to support the claim that an agreement to end the war was reached.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: web_search()

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background.

NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.russiamatters.org/news/russia-ukraine-war-report-card/russia-ukraine-war-report-card-feb-26-2025): 
Content: "Area roughly equivalent to about 2 Martha’s Vineyard islands.2
*   In past week: Russia gained **35** square miles, the equivalent of 1½ Manhattan islands. 
    *   Ukraine lost **10** square miles in Russia’s Kursk Oblast, which is the fastest rate of loss of Russian territory for Ukraine since early December 2024.

**Infrastructure**

*   Russia: A journalistic investigation estimated in March 2024 that Ukrainian strikes had rendered facilities which accounted for [1/6th](https://novayagazeta.eu/articles/2024/03/21/zapravka-dlia-dronov)
     of the production of gasoline and diesel fuels in Russia non-operational.
*   Ukraine: 64%, or [36 out of 56 GW](https://www.russiamatters.org/news/russia-ukraine-war-report-card/russia-ukraine-war-report-card-june-25-2024)
     electricity generating capacity destroyed or occupied, Ukraine relies for [2](https://www.wilsoncenter.org/article/ukraines-winter-energy-crisis-facing-threat-missiles-and-default)
    /[3rds](https://www-economist-com.ezp-prod1.hul.harvard.edu/finance-and-economics/2024/12/18/ukraine-is-winning-the-economic-war-against-russia)
     of its electricity generation on three functioning Soviet-era NPPs, which it still controls.

**Popular support**

*   Russia: [61](https://www.levada.ru/2025/02/11/konflikt-s-ukrainoj-v-yanvare-2025-goda-vnimanie-podderzhka-otnoshenie-k-peregovoram-i-vozmozhnym-stranam-posrednikam-mnenie-o-prodolzhitelnosti-i-vozmozhnyh-itogah-konflikta/)
    % support peace negotiations.
*   Ukraine: [51%](https://www.pravda.com.ua/articles/2025/01/27/7495371/)
     support peace negotiations.

**Other criteria which may be even more important (about which we continue to search for reliable indicators):**

*   Ammunition supply
*   Foreign military aid
*   Force generation
*   Military leadership
*   Training
*   Morale
*   Control of strategic locations
*   Information war: with U.S./Europe; with world.

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from Russia Matters, dated February 26, 2025, provides estimates of Russian military casualties in the Ukraine war. It states that more than 700,000 Russian soldiers have been killed or injured, according to a January 2025 estimate. <image:k> The article also mentions 48,000 missing.

_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "As of February 2025, Russia has lost 1.5 million troops in the Ukraine war."

## Actions
```
web_search("Russia Ukraine war troop losses February 2025")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casualties_of_the_Russo-Ukrainian_War): 
Content: "A Russian spokeswoman claimed that she told Johnson in a phone call about the men's treatment that the UK should "show mercy" to Ukrainian citizens by stopping military aid to the Ukrainian government when asked to show the men mercy.[\[603\]](#cite_note-639)

The head of the Ukrainian Coordination Headquarters for POW Treatment, [Iryna Vereshchuk](/wiki/Iryna_Vereshchuk "Iryna Vereshchuk")
, raised concerns that Russia had not released information to Ukrainian authorities on the location of any Ukrainian POW's and the International Red Cross had not been allowed to see them, as of 16 March.[\[604\]](#cite_note-640)

By 21 April, Russia claimed that 1,478 Ukrainian troops had been captured during the course of the [siege of Mariupol](/wiki/Siege_of_Mariupol "Siege of Mariupol")
.[\[605\]](#cite_note-641)
 On 22 April, Yuri Sirovatko, Minister of Justice of the Donetsk People's Republic, claimed that some 3,000 Ukrainian prisoners of war were held in the territory of the DPR.[\[606\]](#cite_note-642)
 On 20 May, the Russian Ministry of Defense claimed that 2,439 Ukrainian soldiers had been taken prisoner over the previous five days as a result of the surrender of the last defenders of Mariupol, entrenched inside the [Azovstal Iron and Steel Works](/wiki/Azovstal_Iron_and_Steel_Works "Azovstal Iron and Steel Works")
.[\[607\]](#cite_note-643)
 On 26 May, Rodion Miroshnik, ambassador of the [Luhansk People's Republic](/wiki/Luhansk_People%27s_Republic "Luhansk People's Republic")
 to Russia, claimed that around 8,000 Ukrainian POWs were held within the territory of the DPR and LPR.[\[608\]](#cite_note-644)
 According to a statement by [Sergei Shoigu](/wiki/Sergei_Shoigu "Sergei Shoigu")
, [Russia's Minister of Defence](/wiki/Minister_of_Defence_(Russia) "Minister of Defence (Russia)")
, in early June 2022, 6,489 Ukrainian soldiers had surrendered since the start of the Russian invasion of Ukraine.[\[609\]](#cite_note-645)

In a report by _[The Independent](/wiki/The_Independent "The Independent")
_ on 9 June, it cited an intelligence report that more than 5,600 Ukrainian soldiers had been captured, while the number of Russian servicemen being held as prisoners had fallen to 550, from 900 in April, following several prisoner exchanges.[\[89\]](#cite_note-UKPOWs-94)
 In contrast, the [Ukrayinska Pravda](/wiki/Ukrayinska_Pravda "Ukrayinska Pravda")
 newspaper claimed 1,000 Russian soldiers were being held as prisoners as of 20 June.

According to Ukraine, as of mid-November 2023, 4,337 Ukrainians were being held by Russia as prisoners of war, including 3,574 soldiers and 763 civilians,[\[610\]](#cite_note-646)
 while by this point 2,598 Ukrainians had been released,[\[611\]](#cite_note-647)
 including 133 civilians.[\[612\]](#cite_note-exchanges-648)
 As of early June 2024, according to Russia, 6,465 Ukrainian soldiers were still being held prisoner in Russia and 1,348 Russian soldiers were prisoners in Ukraine,[\[613\]](#cite_note-649)
 while by this point 3,210 Ukrainians had been confirmed released,[\[614\]](#cite_note-650)
 including 143 civilians.[\[612\]](#cite_note-exchanges-648)
 By 23 July 2025, the number of prisoners released by Russia during prisoner exchanges rose to 5,857,[\[615\]](#cite_note-confirms1200-651)
 including more than 189 civilians.[\[616\]](#cite_note-652)
[\[617\]](#cite_note-653)
 An additional 555 Ukrainians were released by Russia outside of the exchanges.[\[615\]](#cite_note-confirms1200-651)
 At least 800 Russian soldiers had also been confirmed to have been released by late February 2023.[\[618\]](#cite_note-654)
 Between August 2024 and March 2025, 971 Russian soldiers had been captured during [fighting in Kursk Oblast](/wiki/August_2024_Kursk_Oblast_incursion "August 2024 Kursk Oblast incursion")
, according to Ukraine.[\[619\]](#cite_note-655)
 As of the beginning of February 2025, 1,382 Russian servicemen that were previously thought missing were confirmed to be in Ukrainian captivity, while the overall number of Russian prisoners of war was thought to be much higher.[\[620\]](#cite_note-656)

According to the UALosses project, 6,404 Ukrainian soldiers were being held as prisoners as of 23 April 2025.[\[621\]](#cite_note-657)
 By 18 June 2025, the number had fallen to 5,525.[\[15\]](#cite_note-UALosses-17)

A study of Russian prisoners of war captured by Ukraine found that 55% of the soldiers had been motivated to fight to "improve their livelihoods", while 36% were ideologically motivated.[\[622\]](#cite_note-ISW20230504-658)

| Official prisoner exchanges |     |     |     |     |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Number of  <br>exchange | Date | Russian POWs | Ukrainian POWs | Ref. According to their estimate, approximately 2% of all Russian men between the ages of 20 and 50 may have been killed or seriously wounded in Ukraine since February 2022.[\[85\]](#cite_note-90)
 By the end of 2024, _Meduza_ estimated that over 165,000 Russian soldiers had died during the war.[\[86\]](#cite_note-Meduza_165k_dead_31Dec2024-91)

Meanwhile, Ukraine confirmed it had 10,000 killed and 30,000 wounded by the start of June 2022,[\[87\]](#cite_note-92)
 while 7,200 troops were missing,[\[88\]](#cite_note-missingUA-93)
 including 5,600 captured.[\[89\]](#cite_note-UKPOWs-94)
 At the height of the fighting in May and June 2022, according to president Zelenskyy and presidential advisor [Mykhailo Podolyak](/wiki/Mykhailo_Podolyak "Mykhailo Podolyak")
, between 100 and 200 Ukrainian soldiers were being killed in combat daily,[\[90\]](#cite_note-95)
[\[91\]](#cite_note-30dead-96)
 while presidential adviser [Oleksiy Arestovych](/wiki/Oleksiy_Arestovych "Oleksiy Arestovych")
 said 150 soldiers were being killed and 800 wounded daily.[\[92\]](#cite_note-97)
 Mid-June, [Davyd Arakhamia](/wiki/Davyd_Arakhamia "Davyd Arakhamia")
, Ukraine's chief negotiator with Russia, told _Axios_ that between 200 and 500 Ukrainian soldiers were killed every day.[\[93\]](#cite_note-98)
 By late July, Ukrainian daily losses fell to around 30 killed and about 250 wounded.[\[91\]](#cite_note-30dead-96)
 In August 2023, _The New York Times_ quoted unnamed U.S. 11,785 deaths were caused by explosive weapons "with wide area effects", 444 by mines and explosive remnants, 1,351 by small arms, including from crossfire, or road accidents involving military or civilian vehicles.[\[128\]](#cite_note-UNtoll1-134)

As of 30 June 2023, OHCHR said it had received information on 287 civilian casualties in [Western Russia](/wiki/European_Russia "European Russia")
, with 58 killed and 229 injured, while six more were killed and 16 injured in the [Republic of Crimea](/wiki/Republic_of_Crimea_(Russia) "Republic of Crimea (Russia)")
.[\[151\]](#cite_note-UNtoll2-162)
 Another two civilians were killed and one injured in [a Ukrainian drone attack on the Crimean bridge](/wiki/2023_Crimean_Bridge_explosion "2023 Crimean Bridge explosion")
 on 17 July 2023,[\[152\]](#cite_note-Crimeabridge-163)
 while five civilians were killed and 151 were injured by a Ukrainian missile attack in [Sevastopol](/wiki/Sevastopol "Sevastopol")
, in Crimea, on 23 June 2024.[\[153\]](#cite_note-6inRussia-164)
 [Sergey Aksyonov](/wiki/Sergey_Aksyonov "Sergey Aksyonov")
, the Russian-installed head of Crimea, also alleged that a Ukrainian attack on drilling platforms in the [Black Sea](/wiki/Black_Sea "Black Sea")
 near Crimea had left seven [Chernomorneftegaz](/wiki/Chernomorneftegaz "Chernomorneftegaz")
 workers missing.[\[154\]](#cite_note-165)
 The [7x7](/wiki/7x7_(website) "7x7 (website)")
 Russian opposition media outlet confirmed the deaths of 394 civilians in Russia by 25 December 2024, not including those in Crimea.[\[133\]](#cite_note-7x7-141)
 In addition, [missiles struck](/wiki/2022_missile_explosion_in_Poland "2022 missile explosion in Poland")
 the Polish border village of [Przewodów](/wiki/Przewod%C3%B3w "Przewodów")
 in [Lublin Voivodeship](/wiki/Lublin_Voivodeship "Lublin Voivodeship")
 on 15 November 2022, and killed two Polish civilians.[\[155\]](#cite_note-Jasina-2022-166)

In April 2022, the civilian death toll included more than 200 children.[\[156\]](#cite_note-167)
 In March 2022, 55 of the war-related child deaths were from the Kyiv area and another 34 were from Kharkiv.[\[157\]](#cite_note-168)
 On 17 February 2023, the Ukrainian [prosecutor general](/wiki/Prosecutor_General_of_Ukraine "Prosecutor General of Ukraine")
 announced that at least 461 children had been killed since the start of the invasion, with a further 923 wounded.[\[158\]](#cite_note-children-169)
 Most of these child victims were from the [Donetsk region](/wiki/Donetsk_Oblast "Donetsk Oblast")
.[\[158\]](#cite_note-children-169)

By February 2023, Ukrainian chief prosecutor for war crimes Yuriy Belousov claimed that "there could be 100,000 civilians killed across Ukraine, whose bodies will have to be found and identified once occupied territory is liberated."[\[159\]](#cite_note-170)
 A Project on Defense Alternatives study calculated a "modest" figure of 40,000 Ukrainian civilian dead by April 2023.[\[160\]](#cite_note-171)
 In May 2023, US officials claimed Ukrainian civilian deaths were at 42,000, twice the then-estimated figure for Ukrainian military losses.[\[161\]](#cite_note-172)
 According to the [Kyiv Independent](/wiki/Kyiv_Independent "Kyiv Independent")
, Russia does not allow monitoring in territories it controls, where civilian deaths are thought to be highest.[\[162\]](#cite_note-173)

### Foreign civilians

At least 175 foreign citizens civilians from 25 countries are confirmed to have been killed during the war within Ukraine. [Annexation of Crimea by the Russian Federation](/wiki/Annexation_of_Crimea_by_the_Russian_Federation "Annexation of Crimea by the Russian Federation")

Part of the [Russo-Ukrainian War](/wiki/Russo-Ukrainian_War "Russo-Ukrainian War")

[War in Donbas (2014–2022)](/wiki/War_in_Donbas "War in Donbas")

*   Part of the [Russo-Ukrainian War](/wiki/Russo-Ukrainian_War "Russo-Ukrainian War")
    
*   Followed by the [Russian invasion of Ukraine](/wiki/Russian_invasion_of_Ukraine "Russian invasion of Ukraine")

Casualties of the Russo-Ukrainian War

[](#)
[](#)
[](#)
[](#)
[](#)
[](#)
[](#)

16 languages [Add topic](#) 2015 | [US State Department](/wiki/United_States_Department_of_State "United States Department of State")<br>[\[18\]](#cite_note-russiansoldiers-21) |

Initially, the known number of Ukrainian military casualties varied widely due to the Ukrainian Army drastically understating its casualties,[\[19\]](#cite_note-hides-22)
 as reported by medics, activists and soldiers on the ground, as well as at least one lawmaker.[\[19\]](#cite_note-hides-22)
[\[20\]](#cite_note-23)
[\[21\]](#cite_note-24)
[\[22\]](#cite_note-25)
 Several medical officials reported they were overstretched due to the drastic number of casualties.[\[19\]](#cite_note-hides-22)
 Eventually, the [Ukrainian Defence Ministry](/wiki/Ministry_of_Defence_(Ukraine) "Ministry of Defence (Ukraine)")
 stated that the numbers recorded by the National Museum of Military History were the official ones, although still incomplete,[\[23\]](#cite_note-26)
 with 4,638 deaths (4,500 identified and 138 unidentified) cataloged by 1 December 2021.[\[10\]](#cite_note-memory0-11)
[\[b\]](#cite_note-"memory1-15)

According to the [Armed Forces of Ukraine](/wiki/Armed_Forces_of_Ukraine "Armed Forces of Ukraine")
, 1,175 of the Ukrainian servicemen died due to non-combat causes by 5 March 2021.[\[24\]](#cite_note-27)
 Subsequently, the military did not publish new figures on their non-combat losses, stating they could be considered a state secret.[\[25\]](#cite_note-28)

### Deaths by regions

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f1/2018_Ukrainian_Deaths.png/250px-2018_Ukrainian_Deaths.png)](/wiki/File:2018_Ukrainian_Deaths.png)

Deaths of Ukrainian soldiers in 2018.[\[26\]](#cite_note-29)

The following table does not include the 298 deaths from the shootdown of [Malaysia Airlines Flight 17](/wiki/Malaysia_Airlines_Flight_17 "Malaysia Airlines Flight 17")
 or the deaths of Ukrainian servicemen, which are listed separately.

| Region | Fatalities | Time period | Source |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| [Donetsk region](/wiki/Donetsk_Oblast "Donetsk Oblast") | **2,420** civilians and DPR fighters killed[\[27\]](#cite_note-OCHAMarch15-30) | 6 April 2014 – 15 February 2015 | [OCHA](/wiki/OCHA "OCHA") |
| [Luhansk region](/wiki/Luhansk_Oblast "Luhansk Oblast") | **1,185** civilians and LPR fighters killed[\[d\]](#cite_note-34)<br>[\[27\]](#cite_note-OCHAMarch15-30) | 1 May 2014 – 15 February 2015 | [OCHA](/wiki/OCHA "OCHA") |
| [Donetsk region](/wiki/Donetsk_Oblast "Donetsk Oblast") | **4,374** civilians killed[\[31\]](#cite_note-35) | 6 April 2014 – 18 February 2022 | [DPR](/wiki/Donetsk_People%27s_Republic "Donetsk People's Republic") |
| [Luhansk region](/wiki/Luhansk_Oblast "Luhansk Oblast") | **2,269** civilians killed[\[32\]](#cite_note-lug-info.1-36) | 6 April 2014 – 23 February 2022 | [LPR](/wiki/Luhansk_People%27s_Republic "Luhansk People's Republic") |

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3f/%D0%97%D1%83%D1%81%D1%82%D1%80%D1%96%D1%87_%D0%9F%D1%80%D0%B5%D0%B7%D0%B8%D0%B4%D0%B5%D0%BD%D1%82%D0%B0_%D0%A3%D0%BA%D1%80%D0%B0%D1%97%D0%BD%D0%B8_%D1%82%D0%B0_%D0%9F%D1%80%D0%B5%D0%BC%E2%80%98%D1%94%D1%80-%D0%BC%D1%96%D0%BD%D1%96%D1%81%D1%82%D1%80%D0%B0_%D0%92%D0%B5%D0%BB%D0%B8%D0%BA%D0%BE%D1%97_%D0%91%D1%80%D0%B8%D1%82%D0%B0%D0%BD%D1%96%D1%97_%D1%83_%D0%9A%D0%B8%D1%94%D0%B2%D1%96_29.jpg/250px-%D0%97%D1%83%D1%81%D1%82%D1%80%D1%96%D1%87_%D0%9F%D1%80%D0%B5%D0%B7%D0%B8%D0%B4%D0%B5%D0%BD%D1%82%D0%B0_%D0%A3%D0%BA%D1%80%D0%B0%D1%97%D0%BD%D0%B8_%D1%82%D0%B0_%D0%9F%D1%80%D0%B5%D0%BC%E2%80%98%D1%94%D1%80-%D0%BC%D1%96%D0%BD%D1%96%D1%81%D1%82%D1%80%D0%B0_%D0%92%D0%B5%D0%BB%D0%B8%D0%BA%D0%BE%D1%97_%D0%91%D1%80%D0%B8%D1%82%D0%B0%D0%BD%D1%96%D1%97_%D1%83_%D0%9A%D0%B8%D1%94%D0%B2%D1%96_29.jpg)](/wiki/File:%D0%97%D1%83%D1%81%D1%82%D1%80%D1%96%D1%87_%D0%9F%D1%80%D0%B5%D0%B7%D0%B8%D0%B4%D0%B5%D0%BD%D1%82%D0%B0_%D0%A3%D0%BA%D1%80%D0%B0%D1%97%D0%BD%D0%B8_%D1%82%D0%B0_%D0%9F%D1%80%D0%B5%D0%BC%E2%80%98%D1%94%D1%80-%D0%BC%D1%96%D0%BD%D1%96%D1%81%D1%82%D1%80%D0%B0_%D0%92%D0%B5%D0%BB%D0%B8%D0%BA%D0%BE%D1%97_%D0%91%D1%80%D0%B8%D1%82%D0%B0%D0%BD%D1%96%D1%97_%D1%83_%D0%9A%D0%B8%D1%94%D0%B2%D1%96_29.jpg)

A wall of [St. American officials previously said that Ukraine withholds this information from even its closest allies.[\[116\]](#cite_note-losing-121)

Men from the poverty-stricken regions of Russia's [Far North](/wiki/Far_North_(Russia) "Far North (Russia)")
, [Far East](/wiki/Russian_Far_East "Russian Far East")
 and [Siberia](/wiki/Siberia "Siberia")
 were overrepresented among Russian war casualties.[\[117\]](#cite_note-122)
 [Buryats](/wiki/Buryats "Buryats")
, [Kalmyks](/wiki/Kalmyks "Kalmyks")
, [Tuvans](/wiki/Tuvans "Tuvans")
, [Chukchi](/wiki/Chukchi_people "Chukchi people")
, and [Nenets](/wiki/Nenets "Nenets")
 were reported as Russia's [ethnic minority](/wiki/Demographics_of_Russia "Demographics of Russia")
 groups suffering disproportionately high casualty rates among Russian forces.[\[118\]](#cite_note-123)
 On the Ukrainian side, per UA Losses, as of 18 June 2025, the [Dnipropetrovsk Oblast](/wiki/Dnipropetrovsk_Oblast "Dnipropetrovsk Oblast")
 has the highest number of confirmed Ukrainian soldiers dead or missing at 13,594, while the [Kirovohrad Oblast](/wiki/Kirovohrad_Oblast "Kirovohrad Oblast")
 has the highest confirmed death and missing count per capita at 6.062 per 1,000.[\[119\]](#cite_note-124)

In terms of confirmed deaths of officers of both belligerents, according to groups collecting that information, 5,432 Russian officers had been killed as of 29 July 2025,[\[78\]](#cite_note-BBCMediazona-83)
 and 5,857 Ukrainian officers were dead as of 18 June 2025.[\[120\]](#cite_note-125)

According to NATO and Western military officials, around 1,200 Russian soldiers were killed or wounded in Ukraine every day on average in May and June 2024.[\[121\]](#cite_note-126)
[\[122\]](#cite_note-127)
 In July 2024, [Chief of the General Staff](/wiki/Chief_of_the_General_Staff_(United_Kingdom) "Chief of the General Staff (United Kingdom)")
 of the British Army [Sir Roland Walker](/wiki/Sir_Roland_Walker "Sir Roland Walker")
 said that with the current way of fighting, it would take Russia five years to control the four regions of Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson and Zaporizhia that [Russia claims as its own](/wiki/Russian_annexation_of_Donetsk,_Kherson,_Luhansk_and_Zaporizhzhia_oblasts "Russian annexation of Donetsk, Kherson, Luhansk and Zaporizhzhia oblasts")
, and it would cost Russia from 1.5 to 1.8 million casualties.[\[123\]](#cite_note-128)
 He said there are "no winners" in Russia's invasion of Ukraine, adding that "it is an utter devastation for both sides and lost generations."[\[124\]](#cite_note-129)
 By August 2024, the daily average of Russian military casualties in the conflict was about 1,000 soldiers, according to a Western official.[\[125\]](#cite_note-130)

The number of civilian and military deaths is [impossible to determine](/wiki/Fog_of_war "Fog of war")
 with precision.[\[126\]](#cite_note-131)
[\[109\]](#cite_note-MoraleIssue-114)
 The [Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights](/wiki/Office_of_the_United_Nations_High_Commissioner_for_Human_Rights "Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights")
 (OHCHR) considers the number of civilian casualties to be considerably higher than the one the United Nations are able to certify.[\[127\]](#cite_note-132)

[Russian invasion of Ukraine](/wiki/Russian_invasion_of_Ukraine "Russian invasion of Ukraine")

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Wikipedia article "Casualties of the Russo-Ukrainian War" states that in July 2024, a British Army official said that the war would cost Russia 1.5 to 1.8 million casualties. The article also mentions that as of the beginning of February 2025, 1,382 Russian servicemen previously thought missing were confirmed to be in Ukrainian captivity.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background.

NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "As of February 2025, Russia has lost 1.5 million troops in the Ukraine war."

## Actions
```
web_search("Russia Ukraine war troop losses February 2025")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://en.zona.media/article/2025/08/01/casualties_eng-trl): 
Content: "We update the data for this part; the text descriptions are updated but largely remain the same.

For a detailed description of our method for calculating the estimated number of losses based on the Probate Registry data, please [follow the link](https://en.zona.media/article/2024/02/24/75k-trl)
.

**Last update of the named list:** August 1, 2025

**Last update of the Probate Registry estimate:** February 24, 2025; estimate as of December 2024

Full named list of verified losses is available here: [**200.zona.media**](https://200.zona.media)
.

[Leer en español](https://zona.media/article/2025/08/01/perdidas)
[Lire en français](https://zona.media/article/2025/08/01/pertes)
[Auf Deutsch lesen](https://zona.media/article/2025/08/01/verluste)
[Читать на русском](https://zona.media/casualties)

Faced with mounting losses in Ukraine, the Russian authorities moved quickly to decide how the deaths of soldiers would be reported. **Russian losses in the war with Ukraine.**  
Mediazona count, updated
======================================================================

_Mediazona,_ in collaboration with _BBC News_ Russian service and a team of volunteers, maintains a named list of deceased Russian military personnel. Here we report what we’ve learned about the losses during this time and the events at the front that led to the deaths of Russian soldiers.

**Interactive Infographics.** The second part showcases visual representations of losses since the beginning of the war: for example, where the deceased served or in which regions they lived. These are absolute numbers, not adjusted for population or number of military units.

On the map, you can choose between total losses and losses by military branch, as well as see where the deceased mobilised soldiers were from.

In most cases, from death reports or indirect signs (uniform or sleeve patches in photos), it’s possible to determine which branch of the military the deceased served in, or how they joined the army (mobilised, volunteer, prisoner, etc.)

We compared these groups of servicemen on a separate graph.

From early summer and into the mid-fall season of 2022, volunteers bore the brunt of the losses, which is strikingly different from the situation in the initial stage of the war: in winter and early spring, the Airborne Forces suffered the greatest damage, followed by the Motorised Rifle troops.

By the end of 2022 and the beginning of the next year, losses among prisoners recruited into the _Wagner PMC_ increased markedly. The children are too young to understand what the plaques mean, but they walk past them all the same.

What we know about losses
-------------------------

Here’s how the losses are distributed across Russian regions. They were formed into “assault groups” to overwhelm Ukrainian positions near Bakhmut.

By March 2023, prisoners became the largest category of war losses. By November 2024, this figure had dropped to between 2–3%—a shift that reflects both evolving combat tactics and the intensive recruitment of volunteer infantry, who suffer casualty rates many times higher than their commanding officers.

**Officers killed in Ukraine**

To date, reports of the deaths of two deputy army commanders have been officially confirmed—Major General Andrei Sukhovetsky of the 41st Army and Major General Vladimir Frolov of the 8th Army.

On May 22, 2022, fighter pilot, 63-year-old retired Major General Kanamat Botashev died; most likely, he went to war as a volunteer. This list is not exhaustive, as not every military death becomes public knowledge.

To provide a more comprehensive picture of the war’s impact, we offer a second figure: an estimate of excess mortality among men, based on Probate registry data. This method was developed in collaboration with _Meduza_, to address the limitations of relying solely on publicly reported deaths.

[**EN ESPAÑOL**](https://zona.media/article/2025/07/18/perdidas)
[](https://en.zona.media/article/2022/05/11/casualties_eng)
 **┃** [**ПО-РУССКИ**](https://zona.media/casualties)

[**AUF DEUTSCH**](https://zona.media/article/2025/06/06/verluste)
 [](https://en.zona.media/article/2022/05/11/casualties_eng)
[](https://en.zona.media/article/2022/05/11/casualties_eng)
**┃** [**EN FRANÇAIS**](https://zona.media/article/2025/06/06/pertes)
[](https://en.zona.media/article/2022/05/11/casualties_eng)

About our reports
-----------------

This publication is divided into two parts:

**Bi-weekly Summary.** A text summary, updated every two weeks. It began before the full-scale war and was originally meant to honour veterans of the Second World War and soldiers killed in Afghanistan and Chechnya."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from Mediazona, in collaboration with BBC News Russian service, provides an estimate of Russian losses in the war with Ukraine. The last update of the Probate Registry estimate was February 24, 2025, with an estimate as of December 2024. The article also mentions that by November 2024, the number of losses among prisoners had dropped to between 2–3%.

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "As of February 2025, Russia has lost 1.5 million troops in the Ukraine war."

## Actions
```
web_search("Russia Ukraine war troop losses February 2025")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://www.russiamatters.org/news/russia-ukraine-war-report-card/russia-ukraine-war-report-card-feb-26-2025): 
Content: The search result from Russia Matters, dated February 26, 2025, provides estimates of Russian military casualties in the Ukraine war. It states that more than 700,000 Russian soldiers have been killed or injured, according to a January 2025 estimate. <image:k> The article also mentions 48,000 missing.


From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casualties_of_the_Russo-Ukrainian_War): 
Content: The Wikipedia article "Casualties of the Russo-Ukrainian War" states that in July 2024, a British Army official said that the war would cost Russia 1.5 to 1.8 million casualties. The article also mentions that as of the beginning of February 2025, 1,382 Russian servicemen previously thought missing were confirmed to be in Ukrainian captivity.


From [Source](https://en.zona.media/article/2025/08/01/casualties_eng-trl): 
Content: The search result from Mediazona, in collaboration with BBC News Russian service, provides an estimate of Russian losses in the war with Ukraine. The last update of the Probate Registry estimate was February 24, 2025, with an estimate as of December 2024. The article also mentions that by November 2024, the number of losses among prisoners had dropped to between 2–3%.


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
According to a Russia Matters article from February 26, 2025, over 700,000 Russian soldiers have been killed or injured in the Ukraine war, with an additional 48,000 missing (<image:k>). A Wikipedia article notes that a British Army official estimated 1.5 to 1.8 million Russian casualties by July 2024, and that as of early February 2025, 1,382 Russian servicemen previously missing were confirmed in Ukrainian captivity.

Mediazona, in collaboration with BBC News Russian service, provided an estimate of Russian losses, with the last update from February 24, 2025, estimating losses as of December 2024. The article also mentions that by November 2024, the number of losses among prisoners had dropped to between 2–3%.
*   [https://www.russiamatters.org/news/russia-ukraine-war-report-card/russia-ukraine-war-report-card-feb-26-2025](https://www.russiamatters.org/news/russia-ukraine-war-report-card/russia-ukraine-war-report-card-feb-26-2025)
*   [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casualties_of_the_Russo-Ukrainian_War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casualties_of_the_Russo-Ukrainian_War)
*   [https://en.zona.media/article/2025/08/01/casualties_eng-trl](https://en.zona.media/article/2025/08/01/casualties_eng-trl)

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "As of February 2025, Russia has lost 1.5 million troops in the Ukraine war."

## Actions
```
web_search("Russia Ukraine war troop losses February 2025")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
According to a Russia Matters article from February 26, 2025, over 700,000 Russian soldiers have been killed or injured in the Ukraine war, with an additional 48,000 missing (<image:k>). A Wikipedia article notes that a British Army official estimated 1.5 to 1.8 million Russian casualties by July 2024, and that as of early February 2025, 1,382 Russian servicemen previously missing were confirmed in Ukrainian captivity.

Mediazona, in collaboration with BBC News Russian service, provided an estimate of Russian losses, with the last update from February 24, 2025, estimating losses as of December 2024. The article also mentions that by November 2024, the number of losses among prisoners had dropped to between 2–3%.
*   [https://www.russiamatters.org/news/russia-ukraine-war-report-card/russia-ukraine-war-report-card-feb-26-2025](https://www.russiamatters.org/news/russia-ukraine-war-report-card/russia-ukraine-war-report-card-feb-26-2025)
*   [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casualties_of_the_Russo-Ukrainian_War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casualties_of_the_Russo-Ukrainian_War)
*   [https://en.zona.media/article/2025/08/01/casualties_eng-trl](https://en.zona.media/article/2025/08/01/casualties_eng-trl)


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence suggests that the claim is not entirely accurate. While a British Army official estimated 1.5 to 1.8 million Russian casualties by July 2024, the provided sources offer different figures for February 2025. One source indicates over 700,000 Russian soldiers killed or injured, with an additional 48,000 missing as of February 26, 2025. Another source mentions that by early February 2025, 1,382 Russian servicemen previously missing were confirmed in Ukrainian captivity.

The Mediazona article, with its last update from February 24, 2025, provides an estimate of losses as of December 2024, but does not specify the exact number. Therefore, the claim of 1.5 million troop losses as of February 2025 is not directly supported by the provided evidence, although the total casualties could be close to that number.

To fully verify the claim, more specific data on the total number of Russian troop losses, including killed, wounded, missing, and captured, as of February 2025, would be needed.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.



## Decision Options
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "As of February 2025, Russia has lost 1.5 million troops in the Ukraine war."

## Actions
```
web_search("Russia Ukraine war troop losses February 2025")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
According to a Russia Matters article from February 26, 2025, over 700,000 Russian soldiers have been killed or injured in the Ukraine war, with an additional 48,000 missing (<image:k>). A Wikipedia article notes that a British Army official estimated 1.5 to 1.8 million Russian casualties by July 2024, and that as of early February 2025, 1,382 Russian servicemen previously missing were confirmed in Ukrainian captivity.

Mediazona, in collaboration with BBC News Russian service, provided an estimate of Russian losses, with the last update from February 24, 2025, estimating losses as of December 2024. The article also mentions that by November 2024, the number of losses among prisoners had dropped to between 2–3%.
*   [https://www.russiamatters.org/news/russia-ukraine-war-report-card/russia-ukraine-war-report-card-feb-26-2025](https://www.russiamatters.org/news/russia-ukraine-war-report-card/russia-ukraine-war-report-card-feb-26-2025)
*   [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casualties_of_the_Russo-Ukrainian_War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casualties_of_the_Russo-Ukrainian_War)
*   [https://en.zona.media/article/2025/08/01/casualties_eng-trl](https://en.zona.media/article/2025/08/01/casualties_eng-trl)


## Elaboration
The evidence suggests that the claim is not entirely accurate. While a British Army official estimated 1.5 to 1.8 million Russian casualties by July 2024, the provided sources offer different figures for February 2025. One source indicates over 700,000 Russian soldiers killed or injured, with an additional 48,000 missing as of February 26, 2025. Another source mentions that by early February 2025, 1,382 Russian servicemen previously missing were confirmed in Ukrainian captivity.

The Mediazona article, with its last update from February 24, 2025, provides an estimate of losses as of December 2024, but does not specify the exact number. Therefore, the claim of 1.5 million troop losses as of February 2025 is not directly supported by the provided evidence, although the total casualties could be close to that number.

To fully verify the claim, more specific data on the total number of Russian troop losses, including killed, wounded, missing, and captured, as of February 2025, would be needed.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence indicates that the claim of 1.5 million Russian troop losses as of February 2025 is not directly supported by the provided sources. While there are estimates of casualties, the exact number of losses is not confirmed. The sources provide different figures and estimates, making it difficult to definitively confirm the claim.

`not enough information`

_________________________



PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: web_search()

## Claim

Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

```

Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "As of February 2025, Russia has lost 1.5 million troops in the Ukraine war."

## Actions
```
web_search("Russia Ukraine war troop losses February 2025")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
According to a Russia Matters article from February 26, 2025, over 700,000 Russian soldiers have been killed or injured in the Ukraine war, with an additional 48,000 missing (<image:k>). A Wikipedia article notes that a British Army official estimated 1.5 to 1.8 million Russian casualties by July 2024, and that as of early February 2025, 1,382 Russian servicemen previously missing were confirmed in Ukrainian captivity.

Mediazona, in collaboration with BBC News Russian service, provided an estimate of Russian losses, with the last update from February 24, 2025, estimating losses as of December 2024. The article also mentions that by November 2024, the number of losses among prisoners had dropped to between 2–3%.
*   [https://www.russiamatters.org/news/russia-ukraine-war-report-card/russia-ukraine-war-report-card-feb-26-2025](https://www.russiamatters.org/news/russia-ukraine-war-report-card/russia-ukraine-war-report-card-feb-26-2025)
*   [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casualties_of_the_Russo-Ukrainian_War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casualties_of_the_Russo-Ukrainian_War)
*   [https://en.zona.media/article/2025/08/01/casualties_eng-trl](https://en.zona.media/article/2025/08/01/casualties_eng-trl)


## Elaboration
The evidence suggests that the claim is not entirely accurate. While a British Army official estimated 1.5 to 1.8 million Russian casualties by July 2024, the provided sources offer different figures for February 2025. One source indicates over 700,000 Russian soldiers killed or injured, with an additional 48,000 missing as of February 26, 2025. Another source mentions that by early February 2025, 1,382 Russian servicemen previously missing were confirmed in Ukrainian captivity.

The Mediazona article, with its last update from February 24, 2025, provides an estimate of losses as of December 2024, but does not specify the exact number. Therefore, the claim of 1.5 million troop losses as of February 2025 is not directly supported by the provided evidence, although the total casualties could be close to that number.

To fully verify the claim, more specific data on the total number of Russian troop losses, including killed, wounded, missing, and captured, as of February 2025, would be needed.


# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
web_search("Russia Ukraine war total casualties February 2025")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background.

NONE

The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "As of February 2025, Russia has lost 1.5 million troops in the Ukraine war."

## Actions

```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
According to a Russia Matters article from February 26, 2025, over 700,000 Russian soldiers have been killed or injured in the Ukraine war, with an additional 48,000 missing (<image:k>). A Wikipedia article notes that a British Army official estimated 1.5 to 1.8 million Russian casualties by July 2024, and that as of early February 2025, 1,382 Russian servicemen previously missing were confirmed in Ukrainian captivity.

*   [https://www.russiamatters.org/news/russia-ukraine-war-report-card/russia-ukraine-war-report-card-feb-26-2025](https://www.russiamatters.org/news/russia-ukraine-war-report-card/russia-ukraine-war-report-card-feb-26-2025)

## Elaboration

While a British Army official estimated 1.5 to 1.8 million Russian casualties by July 2024, the provided sources offer different figures for February 2025. One source indicates over 700,000 Russian soldiers killed or injured, with an additional 48,000 missing as of February 26, 2025. Another source mentions that by early February 2025, 1,382 Russian servicemen previously missing were confirmed in Ukrainian captivity.

The Mediazona article, with its last update from February 24, 2025, provides an estimate of losses as of December 2024, but does not specify the exact number. Therefore, the claim of 1.5 million troop losses as of February 2025 is not directly supported by the provided evidence, although the total casualties could be close to that number.

To fully verify the claim, more specific data on the total number of Russian troop losses, including killed, wounded, missing, and captured, as of February 2025, would be needed.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.csis.org/analysis/russias-battlefield-woes-ukraine): 
Content: "As Figure 7 shows, there were as many as 250,000 Russian fatalities in Ukraine between February 2022 and May 2025, compared to a high of roughly 50,000 total Soviet and Russian fatalities in all wars combined between World War II and February 2022. Jones](/people/seth-g-jones)

President, Defense and Security Department; Harold Brown Chair

Related Content
---------------

Image

     !Photo: CSIS <image:4825>

[](/events/one-million-casualties-russias-losses-battlefield)

### [One Million Casualties: Russia’s Losses on the Battlefield](/events/one-million-casualties-russias-losses-battlefield)

June 13, 2025 • 11:00 – 11:30 am EDT

Hosted by Warfare, Irregular Threats, and Terrorism Program

Image

     !Photo: Roberto Schmidt/Getty Images <image:4826>

[](/analysis/can-ukraine-fight-without-us-aid-seven-questions-ask)

### [Can Ukraine Fight Without U.S. Jones](/people/seth-g-jones) and [Riley McCabe](/people/riley-mccabe)

Published June 3, 2025

### Available Downloads

*   [Download the Brief 13385kb](https://csis-website-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/s3fs-public/2025-06/250603_Jones_Battlefield_Woes_0.pdf?VersionId=swtz75pqU3Del_5mBFQfV5dYKCS8J_gz)
    

Remote Visualization

**The Issue**
-------------

_Russian military forces have failed to effectively advance along multiple axes in Ukraine, seized limited territory, lost substantial quantities of equipment relative to Ukraine, and suffered remarkably high rates of fatalities and casualties since January 2024, according to new CSIS data. Overall, a high of 250,000 Russian soldiers have died in Ukraine, with over 950,000 total Russian casualties, a sign of Putin’s blatant disregard for his soldiers. To put these numbers into historical perspective, Russia has suffered roughly five times as many fatalities in Ukraine as in all Russian and Soviet wars _combined_ between the end of World War II and the start of the full-scale invasion in February 2022. While Putin may have hoped that Russia’s military would quickly defeat Ukrainian forces and topple the government in February 2022, it failed to do so.

Since early 2024, Russia has held the initiative in the war in Ukraine.13 As used here, “initiative” involves attacking—or threatening to attack—an enemy to force it to react or deny it the ability to act. For each case, the measured distance is divided by the number of days of the campaign to calculate the average rate of advance in meters per day.

Along the Donetsk front in the east, Russia launched a renewed offensive in October 2023 and captured the fortified city of Avdiivka in February 2024 after one of the war’s most intense battles.26 From that point through April 2025, Russian forces advanced approximately 60 kilometers westward toward the city of Pokrovsk—an average of just 135 meters per day.

Russia’s progress has been even slower near Kharkiv in the north. <image:4822>](https://csis-website-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/s3fs-public/2025-06/250603_Jones_Battlefield_Woes_Fig3d.jpg?VersionId=OQLKrhs9OgGt7KHCiiEvPceOTOiOzL9O)

The slow pace of Russia’s recent advances is part of a broader pattern that has defined the war in Ukraine. No Soviet or Russian war since World War II has even come close to Ukraine in terms of fatality rate.

Remote Visualization

In addition, over 950,000 Russian soldiers have been killed and wounded since the war began.36 As Figure 8 highlights, Russia’s daily average of casualties has increased _every year_ since 2022. Putin likely considers these types of soldiers more expendable and less likely to undermine his domestic political support base.37

Ukrainian fatality rates are also high at between 60,000 and 100,000 Ukrainian soldiers killed, with a total of 400,000 casualties (which include both killed and wounded).38

Remote Visualization

**Russia Does Not Hold All the Cards**
--------------------------------------

Russia has struggled in Ukraine."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
According to a CSIS article published on June 3, 2025, there were as many as 250,000 Russian fatalities in Ukraine between February 2022 and May 2025, with over 950,000 total Russian casualties. <image:4824>, <image:4825>, <image:4826>. The article also mentions that the daily average of Russian casualties has increased every year since 2022.

_________________________



DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "As of February 2025, Russia has lost 1.5 million troops in the Ukraine war."

## Actions
```
web_search("Russia Ukraine war troop losses February 2025")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
According to a Russia Matters article from February 26, 2025, over 700,000 Russian soldiers have been killed or injured in the Ukraine war, with an additional 48,000 missing (<image:k>). A Wikipedia article notes that a British Army official estimated 1.5 to 1.8 million Russian casualties by July 2024, and that as of early February 2025, 1,382 Russian servicemen previously missing were confirmed in Ukrainian captivity.

Mediazona, in collaboration with BBC News Russian service, provided an estimate of Russian losses, with the last update from February 24, 2025, estimating losses as of December 2024. The article also mentions that by November 2024, the number of losses among prisoners had dropped to between 2–3%.
*   [https://www.russiamatters.org/news/russia-ukraine-war-report-card/russia-ukraine-war-report-card-feb-26-2025](https://www.russiamatters.org/news/russia-ukraine-war-report-card/russia-ukraine-war-report-card-feb-26-2025)
*   [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casualties_of_the_Russo-Ukrainian_War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casualties_of_the_Russo-Ukrainian_War)
*   [https://en.zona.media/article/2025/08/01/casualties_eng-trl](https://en.zona.media/article/2025/08/01/casualties_eng-trl)


## Elaboration
The evidence suggests that the claim is not entirely accurate. While a British Army official estimated 1.5 to 1.8 million Russian casualties by July 2024, the provided sources offer different figures for February 2025. One source indicates over 700,000 Russian soldiers killed or injured, with an additional 48,000 missing as of February 26, 2025. Another source mentions that by early February 2025, 1,382 Russian servicemen previously missing were confirmed in Ukrainian captivity.

The Mediazona article, with its last update from February 24, 2025, provides an estimate of losses as of December 2024, but does not specify the exact number. Therefore, the claim of 1.5 million troop losses as of February 2025 is not directly supported by the provided evidence, although the total casualties could be close to that number.

To fully verify the claim, more specific data on the total number of Russian troop losses, including killed, wounded, missing, and captured, as of February 2025, would be needed.


## Actions
```
web_search("Russia Ukraine war total casualties February 2025")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
From [Source](https://www.csis.org/analysis/russias-battlefield-woes-ukraine): 
Content: According to a CSIS article published on June 3, 2025, there were as many as 250,000 Russian fatalities in Ukraine between February 2022 and May 2025, with over 950,000 total Russian casualties. <image:4824>, <image:4825>, <image:4826>. The article also mentions that the daily average of Russian casualties has increased every year since 2022.


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The new evidence from a CSIS article published on June 3, 2025, states that there were over 950,000 total Russian casualties between February 2022 and May 2025, with approximately 250,000 fatalities. This information contradicts the claim that Russia had lost 1.5 million troops by February 2025.

The additional search revealed a CSIS article stating over 950,000 total Russian casualties between February 2022 and May 2025, with approximately 250,000 fatalities. This evidence contradicts the claim.
